body:
Hello everyone,

The moderation staff team is having a staff meeting this Friday and it's a great opportunity for community issues/suggestions to be discussed and sorted.

So fire away with whatever you want to be brought up on Friday.

Topics:
  • Advertisement for devs
  • Activity overall (including admins and devs)
  • Increase in aussie staff
  • Anti-cheat discussion
  • Server advertisement
  • YouTubers
Peace,
Aura

I'm already a staff member, but from what I can see:

  4. Why are there so many seniors when the average is generally 3-4? We now have 6. Why?

replies.body: agree with {tag=c29bef37d8e242a9b74604f2df78f374}
replies.body_tagged: agree with Legoche

replies.body:
I'd have to agree with Snow. No one wants to come to a server with no active Devs, very few active staff at all, along with lots of glitches. If I was looking for a server and I found Avicus I wouldn't stay. There is never a Dev on, which from a new person perspective means no development is happening what-so-ever.

Player count has been increasing slowly, so that should not be a top priority. Keep doing what ever we are doing there.

Developing and updates should be faster. There's been many glitches that are brought up in topics all the time and nothing gets done about them, and now with the most active Dev gone that is going to be even slower.

Staff activity... I have no clue why so many staff are inactive, but that's going to be brought up in the staff meeting already. I know I don't see everyone online because of timezones but I'm on  most of the day for myself. This includes the beginning and end of a few different time zones and 99% of the time I'm on alone or with one and sometimes two other people. I know school is a pretty big factor with activity along with just life in general, but from what I see the active staff that I see everyday or almost every day are myself, MyWorld, Junr, Abusive,PieZ, Para, Badger, and Prodigy. For having 32 staff members (including Seniors and Admins) that is sad. (Those are only ones I know are on everyday or pretty close to it. There are probably a few that are on but I just don't see.)

Now onto things I know a lot of people are curious about and things I've thought of:

-Rules.
     *There are a lot of "rules" that aren't in the rules. 
     *There are also a few rules that don't make a lot of sense. For example the gap between names and chat behavior. You can't have a name that isn't appropriate for all ages, but chat is allowed to be vulgar and sometimes it can get sexual. I understand certain things but if there's a rule for something it shouldn't be allowed in other ways. It just doesn't make sense.


(I will add more as I think of them.)

replies.body:
Please add these topics:
  • Maps: Put Quintus, Ternio, Halcyon, and Dust Devils back on Destroy1 server
  • Maps: Find Gladiator and put it on Deathmatch server
  • Message: Welcome message for new or kinda new players (logged in less than 10 times). Have an announcement say Hi to them, so more veteran players can say HI too and welcome them. 
  • Walls!
  • Tags: Update the command /list that could list all the players and include the player's team tag if they are on one.   example:  Murphh [Gold] [HOME]
Thanks for reading!

replies.body:
the staff team does not do anything with maps or rotations
those are for the map developers 
and also refer to my good boi distraction

we need devs to make walls

the team tag would spam /list and would be really hard to read imo

All the staff team can do is talk about issues regarding the server and how we can fix it (such as advertisement or discussion of future plans). We can't really touch rotations/mapsnas those are put onto the map developers but you are welcome to post here: https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/5671b2f86 for any suggestions to rotations and I'm sure one of the 5 mapdevs can help you.

reply_to.body:
I'd have to agree with Snow. No one wants to come to a server with no active Devs, very few active staff at all, along with lots of glitches. If I was looking for a server and I found Avicus I wouldn't stay. There is never a Dev on, which from a new person perspective means no development is happening what-so-ever.

Player count has been increasing slowly, so that should not be a top priority. Keep doing what ever we are doing there.

Developing and updates should be faster. There's been many glitches that are brought up in topics all the time and nothing gets done about them, and now with the most active Dev gone that is going to be even slower.

Staff activity... I have no clue why so many staff are inactive, but that's going to be brought up in the staff meeting already. I know I don't see everyone online because of timezones but I'm on  most of the day for myself. This includes the beginning and end of a few different time zones and 99% of the time I'm on alone or with one and sometimes two other people. I know school is a pretty big factor with activity along with just life in general, but from what I see the active staff that I see everyday or almost every day are myself, MyWorld, Junr, Abusive,PieZ, Para, Badger, and Prodigy. For having 32 staff members (including Seniors and Admins) that is sad. (Those are only ones I know are on everyday or pretty close to it. There are probably a few that are on but I just don't see.)

Now onto things I know a lot of people are curious about and things I've thought of:

-Rules.
     *There are a lot of "rules" that aren't in the rules. 
     *There are also a few rules that don't make a lot of sense. For example the gap between names and chat behavior. You can't have a name that isn't appropriate for all ages, but chat is allowed to be vulgar and sometimes it can get sexual. I understand certain things but if there's a rule for something it shouldn't be allowed in other ways. It just doesn't make sense.


(I will add more as I think of them.)

replies.body: Just regarding staff activity, Senior Moderators and Admins have other responsibilities than moderating the server. Sure it would be nice to see them on, but at the end of the day they are there for server management, not moderating. That's why you are on the staff team.

If I was looking for a server and I found Avicus I wouldn't stay. There is never a Dev on, which from a new person perspective means no development is happening what-so-ever.

Player count has been increasing slowly, so that should not be a top priority. Keep doing what ever we are doing there.

Developing and updates should be faster. There's been many glitches that are brought up in topics all the time and nothing gets done about them, and now with the most active Dev gone that is going to be even slower.

Staff activity... I have no clue why so many staff are inactive, but that's going to be brought up in the staff meeting already. I know I don't see everyone online because of timezones but I'm on  most of the day for myself. This includes the beginning and end of a few different time zones and 99% of the time I'm on alone or with one and sometimes two other people. I know school is a pretty big factor with activity along with just life in general, but from what I see the active staff that I see everyday or almost every day are myself, MyWorld, Junr, Abusive,PieZ, Para, Badger, and Prodigy. For having 32 staff members (including Seniors and Admins) that is sad. (Those are only ones I know are on everyday or pretty close to it. There are probably a few that are on but I just don't see.)

Now onto things I know a lot of people are curious about and things I've thought of:

-Rules.
     *There are a lot of "rules" that aren't in the rules. 
     *There are also a few rules that don't make a lot of sense. For example the gap between names and chat behavior. You can't have a name that isn't appropriate for all ages, but chat is allowed to be vulgar and sometimes it can get sexual. I understand certain things but if there's a rule for something it shouldn't be allowed in other ways. It just doesn't make sense.


(I will add more as I think of them.)
reply_to.body_tagged:
I'd have to agree with Snow. No one wants to come to a server with no active Devs, very few active staff at all, along with lots of glitches. If I was looking for a server and I found Avicus I wouldn't stay. There is never a Dev on, which from a new person perspective means no development is happening what-so-ever.

Player count has been increasing slowly, so that should not be a top priority. Keep doing what ever we are doing there.

Developing and updates should be faster. There's been many glitches that are brought up in topics all the time and nothing gets done about them, and now with the most active Dev gone that is going to be even slower.

Staff activity... I have no clue why so many staff are inactive, but that's going to be brought up in the staff meeting already. I know I don't see everyone online because of timezones but I'm on  most of the day for myself. This includes the beginning and end of a few different time zones and 99% of the time I'm on alone or with one and sometimes two other people. I know school is a pretty big factor with activity along with just life in general, but from what I see the active staff that I see everyday or almost every day are myself, MyWorld, Junr, Abusive,PieZ, Para, Badger, and Prodigy. For having 32 staff members (including Seniors and Admins) that is sad. (Those are only ones I know are on everyday or pretty close to it. There are probably a few that are on but I just don't see.)

Now onto things I know a lot of people are curious about and things I've thought of:

-Rules.
     *There are a lot of "rules" that aren't in the rules. 
     *There are also a few rules that don't make a lot of sense. For example the gap between names and chat behavior. You can't have a name that isn't appropriate for all ages, but chat is allowed to be vulgar and sometimes it can get sexual. I understand certain things but if there's a rule for something it shouldn't be allowed in other ways. It just doesn't make sense.


(I will add more as I think of them.)

replies.body:
Get the plugins in tiptop shape and release a wave of good new maps, not the shit that just came out, then find a youtuber with like 5-10k subs

When tournaments are in planning for several months, Devs need to recognize that hey "We might need to code some tournament plugins" especially when officials spend time getting shit organised and waking up at ungodly hours with 4 Final year assessments due that week to attend fucking meetings. It should not get to the stage where THE DAY WE ARE FORCED TO POSTPONE, developers show up in slack and say "Hey what plugins do you need done" I won't mention Elly's name here, but that made me so triggered.


STAFF ACTIVITY:
It should not get to the stage where if you want to find a mod to rescue the server from half a dozen flyhackers, 3 kids building penises, 2 spleefers/griefers and 2 kids spamming "EZ KIDS GET REKT", fuck the server, fuck the forums, fuck teamspeak, fuck slack, check the smp instead, thats where you'll have more luck. Oh and get another Aussie staff member

EZ

replies.body:
check slack suggestions :
To bring activity to the forums there should be a small bar or icon, like on ocn where it appears when a  media is streaming. It doesn't have to be like ocns one, it could just be a small view in the corner of their screen that you can click to enlarge or shrink! This would bring in views which can help promote Avicus on twitch as the stream will be closer to the top of the Twitch minecraft page, meaning its easier for people to see it and click it! Then people can see avicus and it can promote it if steamers stream regularly. Please put green or red

replies.body:
The activity recently boosted to 4K messages a week. That's approximately 2 and a half weeks to be able to gather info before it resets.
So as long as staff members look at the slack, write down the suggestion a day or so after the suggestions were made, then there shouldn't be any problem.
It's not like the staff slack that resets every other day.

replies.body: If you're going to monitor staff activity please don't leave it up to staff with a completely different timezone. It will appear that they are inactive, they're just not on when you are.
replies.body_tagged: If you're going to monitor staff activity please don't leave it up to staff with a completely different timezone. It will appear that they are inactive, they're just not on when you are.

replies.body: If they decide to do this they will probably just look on how many hours in total they have been on for a week. Then they can easily find out if they are on often, how much they are on, and all that kind of stuff

replies.body:
That's not how it would work.
Talking to Pete about my suggestion of activity checks, is on minimum of certain command infractions given out (ex: a certain amount of warns, kicks, bans per month), if they go on ts or not, active or not in slack and many other stuff to influence the activity check decision.

replies.body:
-Fixing minor glitches in maps 
-Voting (Better rewards though)
-Double credit weekends . Adding on to that, maybe having a credit multiplier throughout Christmas until New Years?
-After someone getting a killstreak in-game (5,10 etc) it could say : "roadmanryan is on a 10 killstreak!"
- /rules command which has a link to the avicus ruleset
-Voting on a map at the end which could give feedback for the MapDevs
-Staff activity
-Maybe saying gg at the end of a game will give you 20 credits (for all ranks)

replies.body:
What was said?
  • Getting new devs has been top priority as of recent and... ;)
  • Pie is taking on activity improvement for the mods.
  • There is not enough funds for YouTubers.
  • Over 30 YouTubers were looked into, but their prices were way too high.
  • There was also discussion on temp and perm retirements.
Thanks for your suggestions!
